header: Cri. Bail Appl. No. 3/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­017660­2018 ) Amar Dhumal & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is a successive application by 1] Amar Ramrao Dhumal 2] Tushar Ashok Bansode for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 375/2018 registered under Sections 370, 370(A) of Indian Penal Code. Section 3, 4 and 5 of The Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act at Police Station, Vimantal, Pune.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 439 of code of criminal procedure
under sections 370, 370(a) of indian penal code
section 3, 4 and 5 of the immoral traffic (prevention) act

arguments.text: 2] Informant Smt. Anita Khedkar, API, Social Security Cell, Crime Branch, Pune reported that, on 22/11/2018 they got information about running a prostitution center at Amantra Spa, Viman Nagar, Pune under pretext of Spa Center. Therefore, raid was arranged. A dummy customer was sent to the center. On his signal, raiding party entered into the premises. They found three girls of Thailand national at the spot. They have recovered amount as well as mobile phone and some objectionable articles at the spot. Then report came to be lodged.

argumentSentences.text: 2] Informant Smt.

Anita Khedkar, API, Social Security Cell, Crime Branch, Pune reported that, on 22/11/2018 they got information about running a prostitution center at Amantra Spa, Viman Nagar, Pune under pretext of Spa Center.
Therefore, raid was arranged.
A dummy customer was sent to the center.
On his signal, raiding party entered into the premises.
They found three girls of Thailand national at the spot.
They have recovered amount as well as mobile phone and some objectionable articles at the spot.
Then report came to be lodged.

arguments.text: 3] Applicants submit that, their earlier bail application was rejected, because investigation was in progress. But now, police have filed charge­sheet. Therefore, there is substantial change in circumstance. They are behind the bars since 23/11/2018. Investigation is over. Therefore, their further custody is not necessary. Hence, they pray for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] Applicants submit that, their earlier bail application was rejected, because investigation was in progress.
But now, police have filed charge­sheet.
Therefore, there is substantial change in circumstance.
They are behind the bars since 23/11/2018.
Investigation is over.
Therefore, their further custody is not necessary.
Hence, they pray for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer and submitted that, there is no substantial change in circumstance. Victim girls are foreign nationals. Therefore, there are strong chances of tampering. Prima facie material is available against the Applicants. Therefore, he prays for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer and submitted that, there is no substantial change in circumstance.
Victim girls are foreign nationals.
Therefore, there are strong chances of tampering.
Prima facie material is available against the Applicants.
Therefore, he prays for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv Mr. Bidkar for Applicants and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers.

argumentSentences.text: 5] Heard the learned Adv Mr. Bidkar for Applicants and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State.
Perused the Papers.

arguments.text: 6] Now, investigation is over, charge­sheet has been filed. Therefore, there is change in circumstance. Prima facie, three victim girls are shown to be major. Investigation with the victim girls is also over. Therefore, further detention of the Applicants may not be necessary. If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of prosecution will be served. Therefore, I prefer to pass following Order.

argumentSentences.text: 6] Now, investigation is over, charge­sheet has been filed.
Therefore, there is change in circumstance.
Prima facie, three victim girls are shown to be major.
Investigation with the victim girls is also over.
Therefore, further detention of the Applicants may not be necessary.
If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of prosecution will be served.
Therefore, I prefer to pass following Order.

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicants, namely, 1] Amar Ramrao Dhumal, 2] Tushar Ashok Bansode be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand Only) each with one or more solvent sureties of the like amount in Crime No. 375/2018 registered under Sections 370, 370(A) of Indian Penal Code. Section 3, 4 and 5 of The Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act at Police Station, Vimantal, Pune Pune on the following terms and conditions. [i] Applicants to attend court dates regularly. [ii] Applicants should not contact witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicants to provide proof of their permanent address and contact details to the investigation officer. [iv] Applicants should not indulge into any crime. [v] Applicants should not change their address and contact details without intimation to the court. [vi] Applicants should not leave India without permission of the Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly. sd/­xxx Pune. (Smt. A. V. Rotte) Date : 04/01/2019. Additional Sessions Judge,Pune

footer: C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P. D. F. file Order are same word for word as per original Order. Name of the Court :­ Smt. A. V. Rotte, District Judge – 7 and Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Name of the Steno :­ Shri. D. L. Gudde, ..3.. processedText:
Cri. Bail Appl. No. 3/2019 ( CNR No. : MHPU01­017660­2018 ) Amar Dhumal & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 1] This is a successive application by 1] Amar Ramrao Dhumal 2] Tushar Ashok Bansode for regular bail under Section 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure in respect of Crime No. 375/2018 registered under Sections 370, 370(A) of Indian Penal Code. Section 3, 4 and 5 of The Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act at Police Station, Vimantal, Pune. 
---background-ends---
2] Informant Smt. Anita Khedkar, API, Social Security Cell, Crime Branch, Pune reported that, on 22/11/2018 they got information about running a prostitution center at Amantra Spa, Viman Nagar, Pune under pretext of Spa Center. Therefore, raid was arranged. A dummy customer was sent to the center. On his signal, raiding party entered into the premises. They found three girls of Thailand national at the spot. They have recovered amount as well as mobile phone and some objectionable articles at the spot. Then report came to be lodged. 
---argument-ends---
3] Applicants submit that, their earlier bail application was rejected, because investigation was in progress. But now, police have filed charge­sheet. Therefore, there is substantial change in circumstance. They are behind the bars since 23/11/2018. Investigation is over. Therefore, their further custody is not necessary. Hence, they pray for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] Learned APP Mr. Satpute appeared for Respondent/State and filed report of investigation officer and submitted that, there is no substantial change in circumstance. Victim girls are foreign nationals. Therefore, there are strong chances of tampering. Prima facie material is available against the Applicants. Therefore, he prays for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Heard the learned Adv Mr. Bidkar for Applicants and the learned APP Mr. Satpute for Respondent/State. Perused the Papers. 
---argument-ends---
6] Now, investigation is over, charge­sheet has been filed. Therefore, there is change in circumstance. Prima facie, three victim girls are shown to be major. Investigation with the victim girls is also over. Therefore, further detention of the Applicants may not be necessary. If strict conditions are imposed, the purpose of prosecution will be served. Therefore, I prefer to pass following Order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicants, namely, 1] Amar Ramrao Dhumal, 2] Tushar Ashok Bansode be released on bail on executing P.R. bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty Five Thousand Only) each with one or more solvent sureties of the like amount in Crime No. 375/2018 registered under Sections 370, 370(A) of Indian Penal Code. Section 3, 4 and 5 of The Immoral Traffic (Prevention) Act at Police Station, Vimantal, Pune Pune on the following terms and conditions. [i] Applicants to attend court dates regularly. [ii] Applicants should not contact witnesses and should not tamper the evidence in the matter. [iii] Applicants to provide proof of their permanent address and contact details to the investigation officer. [iv] Applicants should not indulge into any crime. [v] Applicants should not change their address and contact details without intimation to the court. [vi] Applicants should not leave India without permission of the Court. 3] Bail before the concern Court of Magistrate. 4] Intimate to the concern Police Station accordingly. sd/­xxx Pune. (Smt. A. V. Rotte) Date : 04/01/2019. Additional Sessions Judge,Pune 
---order-ends---
C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P. D. F. file Order are same word for word as per original Order. Name of the Court :­ Smt. A. V. Rotte, District Judge – 7 and Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Name of the Steno :­ Shri. D. L. Gudde, ..3..
